main_definition: Grades refer to the assessment of a student's performance in school or academic subjects, typically represented by letters such as A, B, C, etc., as well as numerical scores.

meanings_and_examples.example: The math teacher gave an F to John for his low performance in the subject.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Numeric score on a test or assignment
meanings_and_examples.example: Sara scored 85 out of 100 on her history exam, which is equivalent to a B grade.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Letter-based ranking in an educational institution
meanings_and_examples.example: At the end of the semester, students receive their grades, ranging from A (excellent) to F (failing).

meanings_and_examples.definition: Levels or standards used for comparison among different groups or individuals
meanings_and_examples.example: The grading system in this country ranges from 100% as an A, down to a D+ which is the lowest passing grade.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Feedback on progress or performance towards achieving goals
meanings_and_examples.example: After receiving his grades for the semester, Michael realized he needed to improve in certain areas and set new goals.
